definition: to rush out through a door (idiom)
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Cang Li Man rushes out of the door.
She dashed through the door, leaving the bar unattended.
sentences.chinese: 她奪門而出，丟下酒吧不管。

sentences.english: Iron man can't stand the big fight with his father, make a dash for the door.
sentences.chinese: 鐵男再也受不了的跟父親大吵，奪門而出。
